cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 50 mi W of the western tip of Cuba and about 540 mi SSE of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northwest across the central Gulf of Mexico and expected to curve slightly northwest, targeting the southeast Louisiana coast before drifting west-northwest across southern Louisiana into east Texas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Louisiana coast near/just west of the mouth of the Mississippi River

weather_observation.under_watch: Hurricane Watch (also under Storm Surge Watch)
weather_observation.watch_coast: Intracoastal City LA to the Mississippi/Alabama border, including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, and Metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from southeast Texas across Louisiana to the Alabama/Florida border
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Yes – isolated totals to 5 inches possible
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Yes – 2–4 ft possible along the lower Mississippi River and adjacent lakes
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–73 mph) likely; brief hurricane-force gusts cannot be ruled out Monday
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft inundation possible along lower Mississippi River levees and in Lake Pontchartrain/Maurepas
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches widespread with isolated 5 inches; risk of flash/urban flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated river levels, strong currents, reduced visibility, potential barge/terminal mooring strain, and brief tornado risk in rainbands
